Emerging growth company&#160;&#160; &#9744; If an emerging growth company, indicate by check mark if the registrant has elected not to use the extended transition period for complying with any new or revised financial accounting standards provided pursuant to Section 13(a) of the Exchange Act.&#160;&#160; &#9744; &#160; &#160; Item&#160;5.07 Submission of Matters to a Vote of Security Holders. The Annual Meeting of Shareholders of Apple Inc. was held on February&#160;26, 2020. At the Annual Meeting, Apple&#8217;s shareholders voted on the following six proposals and cast their votes as described below. 1. The individuals listed below were elected at the Annual Meeting to serve as directors of Apple until the next annual meeting of shareholders and until their successors are duly elected and qualified: &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker &#160;Non-Vote James Bell &#160; 2,578,743,646 &#160; 34,843,929 &#160; 4,835,626 &#160; 1,075,662,518 Tim Cook &#160; 2,585,489,805 &#160; 29,749,089 &#160; 3,184,307 &#160; 1,075,662,518 Al Gore &#160; 2,474,226,124 &#160; 133,621,153 &#160; 10,575,924 &#160; 1,075,662,518 Andrea Jung &#160; 2,453,130,873 &#160; 160,724,576 &#160; 4,567,752 &#160; 1,075,662,518 Art Levinson &#160; 2,484,343,413 &#160; 129,072,939 &#160; 5,006,849 &#160; 1,075,662,518 Ron Sugar &#160; 2,516,822,553 &#160; 96,269,771 &#160; 5,330,877 &#160; 1,075,662,518 Sue Wagner &#160; 2,593,105,163 &#160; 20,656,495 &#160; 4,661,543 &#160; 1,075,662,518 2. A management proposal to ratify the appointment of Ernst&#160;&#038; Young LLP as Apple&#8217;s independent registered public accounting firm for 2020 was approved. &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; &#160; 3,633,943,527 &#160; 50,561,177 &#160; 9,581,015 &#160; 3. An advisory resolution to approve executive compensation was approved. &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker &#160;Non-Vote &#160; 2,457,165,786 &#160; 150,459,135 &#160; 10,798,280 &#160; 1,075,662,518 4. A shareholder proposal entitled &#8220;Shareholder Proxy Access Amendments&#8221; was not approved. &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker &#160;Non-Vote &#160; 808,812,063 &#160; 1,790,041,302 &#160; 19,569,836 &#160; 1,075,662,518 5. A shareholder proposal relating to sustainability and executive compensation was not approved. &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker &#160;Non-Vote &#160; 312,936,051 &#160; 2,282,664,277 &#160; 22,818,423 &#160; 1,075,662,518 6. A shareholder proposal relating to policies on freedom of expression was not approved. &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker &#160;Non-Vote &#160; 1,005,572,589 &#160; 1,468,580,016 &#160; 144,270,596 &#160; 1,075,662,518 SIGNATURE Pursuant to the requirements of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, the Registrant has duly caused this report to be signed on its behalf by the undersigned hereunto duly authorized.
